title: Tuples of classes
content: This subsection gives a definition of an ordered pair, or couple (2-tuple), which "works" for proper classes, as evidenced by Theorems ~ bj-2uplth and ~ bj-2uplex (but more importantly, ~ bj-pr21val and ~ bj-pr22val ). In particular, one can define well-behaved tuples of classes. Classes in ZF(C) are only virtual, and in particular they cannot be quantified over. Theorem ~ bj-2uplex has advantages: in view of ~ df-br , several sethood antecedents could be removed from existing theorems. For instance, ~ relsnopg (resp. ~ relsnop ) would hold without antecedents (resp. hypotheses) thanks to ~ relsnb ). Similarly, ~ df-struct could be simplified with the exception of the empty set removed. The projections are denoted by ` pr1 ` and ` pr2 ` and the couple with projections (or coordinates) ` A ` and ` B ` is denoted by ` (| A ,, B |) ` . Note that this definition uses the Kuratowksi definition ( ~ df-op ) as a preliminary definition, and then "redefines" a couple. It could also use the "short" version of the Kuratowski pair (see ~ opthreg ) without needing the axiom of regularity; it could even bypass this definition by "inlining" it. This definition is due to Anthony Morse and is expounded (with idiosyncratic notation) in Anthony P. Morse, _A Theory of Sets_, Academic Press, 1965 (second edition 1986). Note that this extends in a natural way to tuples. A variation of this definition is justified in ~ opthprc , but here we use "tagged versions" of the factors (see ~ df-bj-tag ) so that an m-tuple can equal an n-tuple only when m = n (and the projections are the same). A comparison of the different definitions of tuples (strangely not mentioning Morse's), is given in Dominic McCarty and Dana Scott, _Reconsidering ordered pairs_, Bull. Symbolic Logic, Volume 14, Issue 3 (Sept. 2008), 379--397. where a recursive definition of tuples is given that avoids the 2-step definition of tuples and that can be adapted to various set theories. Finally, another survey is Akihiro Kanamori, _The empty set, the singleton, and the ordered pair_, Bull. Symbolic Logic, Volume 9, Number 3 (Sept. 2003), 273--298. (available at ~ http://math.bu.edu/people/aki/8.pdf )

blocks.name: bj-projeq
blocks.content: Substitution property for ` Proj ` . (Contributed by BJ, 6-Apr-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-projeq(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wi(wceq(c2, c3), wceq(bj-cproj(c0, c2), bj-cproj(c1, c3))))
} = {
  ex(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3), wceq(bj-cproj(c0, c2), bj-cproj(c1, c3)))
  3eqtr4g(bj-cproj(c0, c2), bj-cproj(c1, c3), cab(hs0, wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c2, csn(c0)))), cab(hs0, wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c3, csn(c1)))), wa(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3)))
  abbidv(hs0, wa(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3)), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c2, csn(c0))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c3, csn(c1))))
  eleq2d(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c2, csn(c0)), cima(c3, csn(c1)), wa(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3)))
  imaeq12d(c2, csn(c0), c3, csn(c1), wa(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3)))
  simpr(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3))
  sneqd(c0, c1, wa(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3)))
  simpl(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3))
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c0, c2)
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c1, c3)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm bj-projeq(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 = c1 ‚Üí(c2 = c3 ‚Üí(c0[Proj]c2)=(c1[Proj]c3)))
} = {
  ex(c0 = c1, c2 = c3, (c0[Proj]c2)=(c1[Proj]c3))
  3eqtr4g((c0[Proj]c2), (c1[Proj]c3), { hs0 | { hs0 } ‚àà(c2 " { c0 })}, { hs0 | { hs0 } ‚àà(c3 " { c1 })}, (c0 = c1 ‚àß c2 = c3))
  abbidv(hs0, (c0 = c1 ‚àß c2 = c3), { hs0 } ‚àà(c2 " { c0 }), { hs0 } ‚àà(c3 " { c1 }))
  eleq2d({ hs0 }, (c2 " { c0 }), (c3 " { c1 }), (c0 = c1 ‚àß c2 = c3))
  imaeq12d(c2, { c0 }, c3, { c1 }, (c0 = c1 ‚àß c2 = c3))
  simpr(c0 = c1, c2 = c3)
  sneqd(c0, c1, (c0 = c1 ‚àß c2 = c3))
  simpl(c0 = c1, c2 = c3)
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c0, c2)
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c1, c3)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 = c1 ‚àß c2 = c3))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
}

blocks.name: bj-projun
blocks.content: The class projection on a given component preserves unions. (Contributed by BJ, 6-Apr-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-projun(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(bj-cproj(c0, cun(c1, c2)), cun(bj-cproj(c0, c1), bj-cproj(c0, c2)))
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, bj-cproj(c0, cun(c1, c2)), cun(bj-cproj(c0, c1), bj-cproj(c0, c2)))
  3bitr4ri(wcel(cv(hs0), bj-cproj(c0, cun(c1, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), cun(bj-cproj(c0, c1), bj-cproj(c0, c2))), wo(wcel(cv(hs0), bj-cproj(c0, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), bj-cproj(c0, c2))), wo(wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c1, csn(c0))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c2, csn(c0)))))
  orbi12i(wcel(cv(hs0), bj-cproj(c0, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), bj-cproj(c0, c2)), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c1, csn(c0))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c2, csn(c0))))
  abeq2i(hs0, bj-cproj(c0, c1), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c1, csn(c0))))
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c0, c1)
  abeq2i(hs0, bj-cproj(c0, c2), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c2, csn(c0))))
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c0, c2)
  elun(cv(hs0), bj-cproj(c0, c1), bj-cproj(c0, c2))
  3bitri(wcel(cv(hs0), bj-cproj(c0, cun(c1, c2))), wo(wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c1, csn(c0))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c2, csn(c0)))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(cun(c1, c2), csn(c0))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cun(cima(c1, csn(c0)), cima(c2, csn(c0)))))
  abeq2i(hs0, bj-cproj(c0, cun(c1, c2)), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(cun(c1, c2), csn(c0))))
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c0, cun(c1, c2))
  eleq2i(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(cun(c1, c2), csn(c0)), cun(cima(c1, csn(c0)), cima(c2, csn(c0))))
  imaundir(c1, c2, csn(c0))
  elun(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(c1, csn(c0)), cima(c2, csn(c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(bj-cproj(c0, cun(c1, c2)))
  diff.hs0.c(cun(bj-cproj(c0, c1), bj-cproj(c0, c2)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cun(c1, c2))
}

thm bj-projun(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0[Proj](c1 ‚ãÉ c2))=((c0[Proj]c1)‚ãÉ(c0[Proj]c2))
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, (c0[Proj](c1 ‚ãÉ c2)), ((c0[Proj]c1)‚ãÉ(c0[Proj]c2)))
  3bitr4ri(hs0 ‚àà(c0[Proj](c1 ‚ãÉ c2)), hs0 ‚àà((c0[Proj]c1)‚ãÉ(c0[Proj]c2)), (hs0 ‚àà(c0[Proj]c1)‚à® hs0 ‚àà(c0[Proj]c2)), ({ hs0 } ‚àà(c1 " { c0 })‚à® { hs0 } ‚àà(c2 " { c0 })))
  orbi12i(hs0 ‚àà(c0[Proj]c1), hs0 ‚àà(c0[Proj]c2), { hs0 } ‚àà(c1 " { c0 }), { hs0 } ‚àà(c2 " { c0 }))
  abeq2i(hs0, (c0[Proj]c1), { hs0 } ‚àà(c1 " { c0 }))
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c0, c1)
  abeq2i(hs0, (c0[Proj]c2), { hs0 } ‚àà(c2 " { c0 }))
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c0, c2)
  elun(hs0, (c0[Proj]c1), (c0[Proj]c2))
  3bitri(hs0 ‚àà(c0[Proj](c1 ‚ãÉ c2)), ({ hs0 } ‚àà(c1 " { c0 })‚à® { hs0 } ‚àà(c2 " { c0 })), { hs0 } ‚àà((c1 ‚ãÉ c2)" { c0 }), { hs0 } ‚àà((c1 " { c0 })‚ãÉ(c2 " { c0 })))
  abeq2i(hs0, (c0[Proj](c1 ‚ãÉ c2)), { hs0 } ‚àà((c1 ‚ãÉ c2)" { c0 }))
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c0, (c1 ‚ãÉ c2))
  eleq2i({ hs0 }, ((c1 ‚ãÉ c2)" { c0 }), ((c1 " { c0 })‚ãÉ(c2 " { c0 })))
  imaundir(c1, c2, { c0 })
  elun({ hs0 }, (c1 " { c0 }), (c2 " { c0 }))
  diff.hs0.c((c0[Proj](c1 ‚ãÉ c2)))
  diff.hs0.c(((c0[Proj]c1)‚ãÉ(c0[Proj]c2)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)

}

thm bj-projval(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))), cif(c3, emptycls, wceq(c2, c0))))
} = {
  syl6eq(bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))), cif(c3, emptycls, wceq(c2, c0)), cif(c3, emptycls, wceq(c0, c2)), wcel(c0, c1))
  sylanblrc(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))), cif(c3, emptycls, wceq(c0, c2))), wi(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))), c3)), wi(wn(wceq(c0, c2)), wceq(bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))), emptycls)))
  ex(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c2), wceq(bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))), c3))
  3eqtr4g(bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))), c3, cab(hs0, wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)), csn(c0)))), cab(hs0, wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), bj-ctag(c3))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c2)))
  abbidv(hs0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c2)), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)), csn(c0))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), bj-ctag(c3)))
  eleq2d(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)), csn(c0)), bj-ctag(c3), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c2)))
  imp(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c2), wceq(cima(cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)), csn(c0)), bj-ctag(c3)))
  syl6bir(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c2), wceq(cima(cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)), csn(c0)), bj-ctag(c3)), wcel(c0, csn(c2)))
  elsng(c0, c1, c2)
  bj-xpima2sn(c0, csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))
  bj-taginv(hs0, c3)
  eq0rdv(hs0, bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))), wn(wceq(c0, c2)))
  mtbiri(wn(wceq(c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), emptycls))
  noel(csn(cv(hs0)))
  syl5bb(wn(wceq(c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), emptycls), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)), csn(c0))))
  abeq2i(hs0, bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)), csn(c0))))
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)))
  eleq2d(csn(cv(hs0)), cima(cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)), csn(c0)), emptycls, wn(wceq(c0, c2)))
  syl(wn(wceq(c0, c2)), wceq(cima(cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)), csn(c0)), emptycls), wnel(c0, csn(c2)))
  sylibr(wn(wceq(c0, c2)), wnel(c0, csn(c2)), wn(wcel(c0, csn(c2))))
  con3i(wceq(c0, c2), wcel(c0, csn(c2)))
  elsni(c0, c2)
  df-nel(c0, csn(c2))
  bj-xpima1sn(c0, csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))
  ifval(bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))), c3, emptycls, wceq(c0, c2))
  ax-mp(wceq(cif(c3, emptycls, wceq(c0, c2)), cif(c3, emptycls, wceq(c2, c0))), wb(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c2, c0)))
  eqcom(c0, c2)
  ifbi(c3, emptycls, wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c2, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c0, c2)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3)))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(bj-cproj(c0, cxp(csn(c2), bj-ctag(c3))))
  diff.hs0.w(wn(wceq(c0, c2)))
}

thm bj-projval(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3)))= if(c2 = c0, c3, ‚àÖ))
} = {
  syl6eq((c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))), if(c2 = c0, c3, ‚àÖ), if(c0 = c2, c3, ‚àÖ), c0 ‚àà c1)
  sylanblrc(c0 ‚àà c1, (c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3)))= if(c0 = c2, c3, ‚àÖ), (c0 = c2 ‚Üí(c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3)))= c3), (¬¨ c0 = c2 ‚Üí(c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3)))= ‚àÖ))
  ex(c0 ‚àà c1, c0 = c2, (c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3)))= c3)
  3eqtr4g((c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))), c3, { hs0 | { hs0 } ‚àà(({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))" { c0 })}, { hs0 | { hs0 } ‚àà tag(c3)}, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c0 = c2))
  abbidv(hs0, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c0 = c2), { hs0 } ‚àà(({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))" { c0 }), { hs0 } ‚àà tag(c3))
  eleq2d({ hs0 }, (({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))" { c0 }), tag(c3), (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c0 = c2))
  imp(c0 ‚àà c1, c0 = c2, (({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))" { c0 })= tag(c3))
  syl6bir(c0 ‚àà c1, c0 = c2, (({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))" { c0 })= tag(c3), c0 ‚àà { c2 })
  elsng(c0, c1, c2)
  bj-xpima2sn(c0, { c2 }, tag(c3))
  bj-taginv(hs0, c3)
  eq0rdv(hs0, (c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))), ¬¨ c0 = c2)
  mtbiri(¬¨ c0 = c2, hs0 ‚àà(c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))), { hs0 } ‚àà ‚àÖ)
  noel({ hs0 })
  syl5bb(¬¨ c0 = c2, hs0 ‚àà(c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))), { hs0 } ‚àà ‚àÖ, { hs0 } ‚àà(({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))" { c0 }))
  abeq2i(hs0, (c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))), { hs0 } ‚àà(({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))" { c0 }))
  df-bj-proj(hs0, c0, ({ c2 } √ó tag(c3)))
  eleq2d({ hs0 }, (({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))" { c0 }), emptycls, ¬¨ c0 = c2)
  syl(¬¨ c0 = c2, (({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))" { c0 })= ‚àÖ, c0 ‚àâ { c2 })
  sylibr(¬¨ c0 = c2, c0 ‚àâ { c2 }, ¬¨ c0 ‚àà { c2 })
  con3i(c0 = c2, c0 ‚àà { c2 })
  elsni(c0, c2)
  df-nel(c0, { c2 })
  bj-xpima1sn(c0, { c2 }, tag(c3))
  ifval((c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))), c3, emptycls, c0 = c2)
  ax-mp(if(c0 = c2, c3, ‚àÖ)= if(c2 = c0, c3, ‚àÖ), (c0 = c2 ‚Üî c2 = c0))
  eqcom(c0, c2)
  ifbi(c3, emptycls, c0 = c2, c2 = c0)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c0 = c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(({ c2 } √ó tag(c3)))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c((c0[Proj]({ c2 } √ó tag(c3))))
  diff.hs0.w(¬¨ c0 = c2)
}

diff.bj-c1upl.c
diff.bj-c1upl.w
df-bj-1upl
blocks.content: Definition of the Morse monuple (1-tuple). This is not useful per se, but is used as a step towards the definition of couples (2-tuples, or ordered pairs). The reason for "tagging" the set is so that an m-tuple and an n-tuple be equal only when m = n. Note that with this definition, the 0-tuple is the empty set. New usage is discouraged because the precise definition is generally unimportant compared to the characteristic properties ~ bj-2upleq , ~ bj-2uplth , ~ bj-2uplex , and the properties of the projections (see ~ df-bj-pr1 and ~ df-bj-pr2 ). (Contributed by BJ, 6-Apr-2019.) (New usage is discouraged.)

thm bj-pr21val(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(bj-cpr1(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), c0)
} = {
  3eqtri(bj-cpr1(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), c0, bj-cpr1(cun(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))), cun(bj-cpr1(bj-c1upl(c0)), bj-cpr1(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))))
  ax-mp(wceq(bj-cpr1(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), bj-cpr1(cun(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))))), wceq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), cun(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))))
  df-bj-2upl(c0, c1)
  bj-pr1eq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), cun(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))))
  bj-pr1un(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))
  eqtri(cun(bj-cpr1(bj-c1upl(c0)), bj-cpr1(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))), c0, cun(c0, emptycls))
  uneq12i(bj-cpr1(bj-c1upl(c0)), bj-cpr1(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))), c0, emptycls)
  bj-pr11val(c0)
  eqtri(bj-cpr1(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))), emptycls, cif(c1, emptycls, wceq(c1o, emptycls)))
  bj-pr1val(c1o, c1)
  iffalsei(c1, emptycls, wceq(c1o, emptycls))
  neii(c1o, emptycls)
  1n0()
  un0(c0)
}

thm bj-pr22val(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(bj-cpr2(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), c1)
} = {
  3eqtri(bj-cpr2(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), c1, cun(bj-cpr2(bj-c1upl(c0)), bj-cpr2(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))), cun(emptycls, c1))
  eqtri(bj-cpr2(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), cun(bj-cpr2(bj-c1upl(c0)), bj-cpr2(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))), bj-cpr2(cun(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))))
  ax-mp(wceq(bj-cpr2(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), bj-cpr2(cun(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))))), wceq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), cun(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))))
  df-bj-2upl(c0, c1)
  bj-pr2eq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), cun(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))))
  bj-pr2un(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))
  uneq12i(bj-cpr2(bj-c1upl(c0)), bj-cpr2(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))), emptycls, c1)
  3eqtri(bj-cpr2(bj-c1upl(c0)), emptycls, bj-cpr2(cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c0))), cif(c0, emptycls, wceq(emptycls, c1o)))
  ax-mp(wceq(bj-cpr2(bj-c1upl(c0)), bj-cpr2(cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c0)))), wceq(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c0))))
  df-bj-1upl(c0)

blocks.name: bj-2uplth
blocks.content: The characteristic property of couples. Note that this holds without sethood hypotheses (compare ~ opth ). (Contributed by BJ, 6-Oct-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-2uplth(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wb(wceq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c2uple(c2, c3)), wa(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c1, c3)))
} = {
  impbii(wceq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c2uple(c2, c3)), wa(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c1, c3)))
  jca(wceq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c2uple(c2, c3)), wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c1, c3))
  3eqtr3g(c0, c2, bj-cpr1(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), bj-cpr1(bj-c2uple(c2, c3)), wceq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c2uple(c2, c3)))
  bj-pr1eq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c2uple(c2, c3))
  bj-pr21val(c0, c1)
  bj-pr21val(c2, c3)
  3eqtr3g(c1, c3, bj-cpr2(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), bj-cpr2(bj-c2uple(c2, c3)), wceq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c2uple(c2, c3)))
  bj-pr2eq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c2uple(c2, c3))
  bj-pr22val(c0, c1)
  bj-pr22val(c2, c3)
  imp(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c1, c3), wceq(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c2uple(c2, c3)))
  bj-2upleq(c0, c2, c1, c3)
}

blocks.name: bj-2uplex
blocks.content: A couple is a set if and only if its coordinates are sets. (Contributed by BJ, 6-Oct-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-2uplex(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wcel(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), universe), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)))
} = {
  impbii(wcel(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), universe), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)))
  jca(wcel(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), universe), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))
  syl5eqelr(c0, universe, bj-cpr1(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), wcel(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), universe))
  bj-pr21val(c0, c1)
  bj-pr1ex(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), universe)
  syl5eqelr(c1, universe, bj-cpr2(bj-c2uple(c0, c1)), wcel(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), universe))
  bj-pr22val(c0, c1)
  bj-pr2ex(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), universe)
  syl5eqel(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), universe, cun(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)))
  df-bj-2upl(c0, c1)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cun(bj-c1upl(c0), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))), universe), wcel(bj-c1upl(c0), universe), wcel(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), universe))
  biimpri(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(bj-c1upl(c0), universe))
  bj-1uplex(c0)
  ax-mp(wi(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), universe)), wcel(csn(c1o), universe))
  snex(c1o)
  bj-xtagex(csn(c1o), universe, c1, universe)
  unexg(bj-c1upl(c0), universe, cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), universe)
}

  ‚ä¢ ((| c0,, c1 |)‚àà ùïå ‚Üî(c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c1 ‚àà ùïå))

  df-bj-2upl(c0, c1)
  syl2an(c0 ‚àà ùïå, c1 ‚àà ùïå, ((| c0 |)‚ãÉ({ 1o } √ó tag(c1)))‚àà ùïå, (| c0 |)‚àà ùïå, ({ 1o } √ó tag(c1))‚àà ùïå)
  biimpri(c0 ‚àà ùïå, (| c0 |)‚àà ùïå)
  bj-1uplex(c0)

  snex(c1o)

  unexg((| c0 |), universe, ({ 1o } √ó tag(c1)), universe)
}

blocks.name: bj-2upln1upl
blocks.content: A couple is never equal to a monuple. It is in order to have this "non-clashing" result that tagging was used. Without tagging, we would have ` (| A , (/) |) = (| A |) ` . Note that in the context of Morse tuples, it is natural to define the 0-tuple as the empty set. Therefore, the present theorem together with ~ bj-1upln0 and ~ bj-2upln0 tell us that an m-tuple may equal an n-tuple only when m = n, at least for m, n <= 2, but this result would extend as soon as we define n-tuples for higher values of n. (Contributed by BJ, 21-Apr-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm bj-2upln1upl(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wne(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c1upl(c2))
} = {
  ax-mp(wne(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c1upl(c2)), wne(cdif(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c1upl(c2)), emptycls))
  mpbi(wne(cdif(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c1upl(c2)), emptycls), wpss(emptycls, cdif(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c1upl(c2))))
  mp2an(wpss(emptycls, cdif(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c1upl(c2))), wpss(emptycls, cdif(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cun(cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c0)), cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c2))))), wss(cdif(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cun(cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c0)), cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c2)))), cdif(bj-c2uple(c0, c1), bj-c1upl(c2))))
  mpbir(wpss(emptycls, cdif(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cun(cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c0)), cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c2))))), wne(cdif(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cun(cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c0)), cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c2)))), emptycls))
  eqnetrri(cdif(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cun(cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c0)), cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c2)))), emptycls, cdif(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cxp(csn(emptycls), cun(bj-ctag(c0), bj-ctag(c2)))))
  difeq2i(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cxp(csn(emptycls), cun(bj-ctag(c0), bj-ctag(c2))), cun(cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c0)), cxp(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c2))))
  xpundi(csn(emptycls), bj-ctag(c0), bj-ctag(c2))
  eqnetri(cdif(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cxp(csn(emptycls), cun(bj-ctag(c0), bj-ctag(c2)))), emptycls, cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))
  ax-mp(wceq(cdif(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cxp(csn(emptycls), cun(bj-ctag(c0), bj-ctag(c2)))), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))), wceq(cin(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cxp(csn(emptycls), cun(bj-ctag(c0), bj-ctag(c2)))), emptycls))
  eqtr3i(cin(cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)), cxp(csn(emptycls), cun(bj-ctag(c0), bj-ctag(c2)))), emptycls, cin(cxp(csn(emptycls), cun(bj-ctag(c0), bj-ctag(c2))), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))))
  incom(cxp(csn(emptycls), cun(bj-ctag(c0), bj-ctag(c2))), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1)))
  ax-mp(wceq(cin(cxp(csn(emptycls), cun(bj-ctag(c0), bj-ctag(c2))), cxp(csn(c1o), bj-ctag(c1))), emptycls), wceq(cin(csn(emptycls), csn(c1o)), emptycls))
